title: Jaded
lyrics:
Mama's getting nervous
'Cause I haven't been to church here in a while
Honestly, I get it, probably feel the same if it was my child
I don't know if it's me or them
But, God, I can't breathe, this stress will kill me
Wish I'd never witnessed the corruption on the inside

Wish I'd never witnessed the corruption on the inside



I don't wanna be jaded

But I'm baring wounds from the church of celebrity

(Jaded, jaded, jaded, jaded, jaded)

I don't wanna be jaded

But I think I'm lost and not who I'm meant to be

(Jaded, jaded, jaded, jaded, jaded)



Another story broke about abuse and, God, I'm feeling crushed

Decades later, pastors richer, famous wallow, women hushed

I don't know if it's me or them

But, God, I can't breathe, this stress will kill me

I know I love justice but remember you're the only judge



I don't wanna be jaded

But I'm baring wounds from the church of celebrity

(Jaded, jaded, jaded, jaded, jaded)

I don't wanna be jaded

But I think I'm lost and not who I'm meant to be

(Jaded, jaded, jaded, jaded, jaded)



Pain and grief are honest friends we need but don't want

I wish nothing bothered me and I could move on

What if we're lost?

Why is it my business if our system's held up by our silent victims?
